website_summaries.verdict: The Yamaha RX-V473 is a serviceable 5.1 AV receiver, but given that it has only four HDMI inputs, competing models offer a better value.
pros: The Yamaha RX-V473 has built-in networking functionality, including AirPlay and Internet radio
Its sound quality is solid with both music and movies, and it can be controlled with a smartphone app that's available for iOS and Android
cons: Nearly every competing receiver offers more HDMI inputs at this price level
The included remote is difficult to use, and the UI looks painfully dated

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy - Missing WIFI!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this receiver, upgraded from a 9 year old Yamaha from my pops awhile back. Hooked up everything VERY easily. So many features and sound options I don't even know where to start or how to tackle. All I've done after a few weeks of owning is use the YPAO MIC to configure the speakers, and also bought the YAMAHA YWA-10BL. This only gets 4 stars, as I can't put a CAT5 cable from my router to my receiver as it's in another room - so to get WIFI I had to purchase the YWA-10BL - how do you not include a WIFI feature in a top end receiver these days?!?
customer_reviews.author: Brad Kublin

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver w/lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Love this receiver and set up was easy. I needed receiver with HDMI connections as well as ability to hookup my old VCR, turntable, etc. Many new receivers do not allow that. I have large living room and this has plenty of power and sounds great with my older Bose speaker system. The only draw back, although minor is that it comes with a CD as an owners manual and after having to go back and forth, I finally printed it out for convenience. I replaced a older Denon unit which I loved and am not at all disappointed with the Yamaha's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Captn' Bob

customer_reviews.title: A great sounding receiver. Only needs a few things to be perfect
customer_reviews.text: The sound is excellent. I used some Polk Audio RM705 speakers (5.1 system), and after adjusting the midrange and using the YPAO, it sounds great. The web radio feature works well as does the Android application. It has individual discrete amplifiers that have their own EQ and gain adjustments so you can accomidate many different speakers. There are also a lot of inputs and it has HDMI idle passthrough. Its only missing a few things...if the on screen display did not look like the menus on a 1988 nintendo game, and it had the ability to convert composite and component video into the HDMI, it would be great. The remote is a little busy too.
customer_reviews.author: scha7530

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I owned an Onkyo surround receiver that died on me before I purchased this Yamaha 473. I kept my Onkyo speakers to pair with my Yamaha receiver. The Yamaha receiver outshines the Onkyo in every way. The sound is better and the functionality is better. The USB port for Iphone or Ipod is very nice. I actually used the YPAO function and this function recognized that one of my front speakers was not connected. About 12 years ago I bought a Yamaha system on clearance and that system served me well for many years. I'm going to stick with Yamaha from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver for the Money
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something inexpensive to use with our bluray player. We do not have cable but like watching movies on dvd/bluray, Netflix, and Prime. We also did not need booming sound. This receiver was easy to set up (had lots of hdmi hookups), easy to use, sounds great, works great, and we are very pleased. The directions were easy (I am a guy and it is sometimes problematical for me to use directions) and things went quick, smooth, and work great. Plus you get the great Yamaha golden sound.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sound and fairly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed this product as my first receiver. So I'm obviously not an expert, but it seems to drive my Polk speakers well and was easy enough to set up, even for a novice. I have a complaint that the YPAO sound optimization for automatic speaker setup doesn't work when you have a center and two L/R speakers. I get an error message, probably because I don't have a full 5.1 speaker arrangement. It seemed like a good value for what you get, price-wise.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I recently sold it like I received it after a couple of years of great sound. I changed it for a new one. Highly recommended! Casual use I am not professional.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it.  The networked model was a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: I searched around for a good receiver for a long time. MY father purchased a Yamaha and I was very pleased with the design and audio output. This particular one works great for me and has all the bells and whistles for a 5.1 channel system. I am glad that I got the networked version because I use the Airplay feature from my iPhone DAILY. It's so nice to play a song remotely from the phone in my pocket instead of having to plug it into a dock. Sounds great, easy to set up, looks sharp. Nothing wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clawson

customer_reviews.title: great product and value
customer_reviews.text: The RX-V473 far exceeded my expectations in every respect. Great sound and picture. Easy setup. Comprehensive manual. Smooth HDMI switching. Don't let the low Amazon price fool you this is a very high quality product with many high end features. If you need 7.1, buy the 573. I have never bought anything but Denon prior to this, but this experience will influence future purchases. Delivery time from Amazon was their usual before I expected it. I highly recommend this product to anybody looking for a 5.1 AVR
customer_reviews.author: handyman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got this almost 2 years ago and always had issues with connecting to my projector. It would need to be reset once every other movie or so. Right before the two year warranty, it stopped sending to the projector altogether. Sound still works. I thought I was lucky that it happened right before the warranty expired, but according to support, the closest repair place is 3 hours away (I live in the capital of North Carolina). So, I have to pay to ship the heavy thing to Yamaha and be without it for "about three weeks". Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: OK eventually, but some issues initially
customer_reviews.text: Everything fine except initially some horrible lip-sync issues. Set it up as recommended: HDMI from both cable box and DVD to AVR then HDMI to TV. Nothing in the manual about possibly needing to set an audio delay for lip sync correction in the audio options but that is what eventually seems to have fixed it (100ms). I thought that this would have been taken care of automatically by the V473 but I'm wondering if my TV (Samsung LCD - 5 years old) may be missing some capability - like ARC? - that enables this.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence W. Keeton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound and price.
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased the Onkyo TX-NR414. However, after setup, and watching tv, it was like my tv had constant hick-ups. I, therefore, returned it to Amazona and purchased the Yamaha RX-VA473. I haven't had any issues with this receiver and it sounds great. The set was also extremely easy - took me about 10-15 minutes to unplug everything from my old receiver to this new one. To date, this receiver has been outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: wilfig12

customer_reviews.title: Very Capable Receiver - Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is packed with features, at a very reasonable price. However, it also manages to be fairly complicated to set-up and operate. [Example: I made an unknown mistake while exploring the set-up features and the receiver stopped producing audio output. I had to find a procedure online to reset to factory default, and then start over] I like this receiver, but I got it for my dad, and he is a bit overwhelmed by its complexity.
customer_reviews.author: Seth W.

customer_reviews.title: Value buy
customer_reviews.text: Nothing too fancy with this receiver, but it provides solid audio/video quality and has plenty of inputs for the average household. If you're really into AV then you probably won't be satisfied with this level of product, but for those who just need a reliable home av receiver, it's a good buy. The Airplay option to wireless play your iPod/iPhone music over the system is a really nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mac1604

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: My first Yamaha receiver, I love it so far. It is easy to use, with quick configuration buttons, and the setup microphone is awesome! This allows you to arrange your speakers, set-up the microphone, run a test, and the unit adjusts sound levels for you. The only thing I noticed this one does not have is separate speaker channels. Otherwise the HDMI, optic ports, and AirPlay makes a wonderful addition to your home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Billings

customer_reviews.title: A great receiver with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: When I got my last receiver, a Pioneer, I didn't think I needed very many HDMI jacks and I couldn't understand why I needed to run everything through the receiver. It didn't take to many years for my needs to change. This receiver has greatly simplified my home theater setup and given me great sound. It is also quite nice to be able to be able to hook it up to a WiFi bridge so that I can control it through my iPad. I haven't found any negatives yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Preisman

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Its amazing that you can purchase a 5.1 receiver with network access for this price! All features work well so far, including the network access and AirPlay. I like the ipod integration. The Gui is basic, and control of an ipod through the receiver is slow, but works fine. The sound quality is OK, but does not seem as dynamic as my older and more expensive receiver. I'm not sure whether this is the receiver or my highly rated but budget speakers. For the price of the overall system, however, I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features and great value
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find all the features that this product had and for a very reasonable price. After owning a Onkyo for 15 years it was a tough decision to go with Yamaha, but after reading many of the reviews about the current equivalent Onkyo products I decided to change. I would recommend this product to anyone who wants a top quality mid-range receiver for a very reasonable price. Of course, I will warn everyone that I am comparing this to my old receiver which would have been considered archaic by today's standards. Either way I did a lot of homework and decided on the Yamaha...which appears to have been the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kiser

customer_reviews.title: First AV receiver I've owned, full of features w/ great sound!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the money. I believe this is a good receiver for years to come. My favorite function is the App control; you can turn the unit on and off with the app. I have it hooked up to a bluetooth adaptor (logitech) and it's pretty awesome. I link my phone with the bluetooth unit, click on the yamaha app, turn it on, and listen my tunes in the living room. I'm not sure what more to expect from an AV receiver!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: I like the way Yamaha sounds
customer_reviews.text: I like the way Yamaha sounds. Consider the price, I'm happy with my purchase. Just enough bells and whistle for me, and a solid workhorse. This is hooked up to a 8OHM speakers and also driving a Polk Audio PSW505. Doesn't get too hot, haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shake and BAKE!

customer_reviews.title: Almost Love It
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is a wonderful receiver. I have 2 minor complaints. Sometimes the pass-thru feature allowing the rcvr to remain in standby while turning on the TV and set-top box doesn't sync up so the TV can't "see" the set-top box. A little fiddling with the inputs puts it in sync. Nuisance, but not a big deal. I may just have to plug the set-top box back into the TV directly. And I was unable to get the rcvr remote programmed to operate the TV, altho I went thru all the codes numerous times.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Mcfadden

customer_reviews.title: Sticking with Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: After having an earlier model Yamaha receiver - I wanted to stick with a quality brand. I don't want to spend too much on a receiver, because after a few years, there is always something new included that you want to have. In this case HDMI connectors. The only complaint I have, so far, is a slight delay in the remote control response to the Tivo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: This product has the connection for every piece of electronic equipment you could possibly imagine. Just hook everything up to your receiver, then go. It eliminates the need for several controllers and the sound it produces is fantastic. Very powerful, easy to use and not as heavy as you would imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago and i love it. The phone/ipad app is excellent and was a deciding factor over other brands. My only regret is not getting the next model up that has a separate channel. i would have hooked up outdoor speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this Yamaha stereo receiver with the built in network you can download an app for your phone or for a tablet and control every aspect of the receiver with your hand held device, has all the connections you could ever need and does a great job. I highly recommend this receiver especially if you’re on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Receiver works great if you connect it to a wired network.
customer_reviews.text: The sound and features are great, but I struggled for a month to get Airplay and Net radio to work reliably. It turns out that the problem was the Yamaha YWA-10 wireless adapter that I also purchased. The signal strength was reasonable but I would always lose connectivity after awhile. Finally I ran a hard-wired Ethernet cable to the receiver from the router and it now works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Usability Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Yamaha RX-V473 receiver based on reviews here and elsewhere and have not been disappointed. A good all around receiver that replaced an older unit. It gave the ability to connect with new technology HDMI accessible TV and DVD player but still works with older CD player and has more than enough power for my speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Love this receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this receiver. The remote control has replaced all the others. It has so many inputs, I don't think I could possibly use them all. The surround is nice -- I love that it has the YPAO mic with it to automatically set the surround sound. My only wish is that AirPlay supported video, instead of just audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding  !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Sony unit.Easy to setup speakers and components it did an software update as soon as connected to the network. For the first time I can play my Itunes and music through my home speakers .Internet Radio is a big plus.The sound is fantastic clear on sharp and gives you tons of adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic so far
customer_reviews.text: Moved my older Sony receiver and Onkyo speakers to my basement (had a Onkyo receiver initially which quit sending sound to the speakers, never buying Onkyo again). Paired this new reciever with Energy Take Classic and the sound quality is just amazing. Haven't messed with the network functions yet but no complaints with this unit so far!
customer_reviews.author: JMSamler

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up if you're electronically literate. I just wish it were easier to stream music to the thing. But it does sound great and interfaced well with my Samsung HDTV, Xbox 360, and when I hooked up my Polk audio 5.1 system to it, wow! What great sound for the price. I'm very very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meeseeks

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, good price
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Crisp highs. - Brings out midrange and lower bass on almost any speaker size - The airplay is a great feature once you get the hang of it. Works with my pandora on my iPhone as well as my macbook pro Cons - Wish it could stream video.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Kellner

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is a winner! The features are simple and the sound quality is exceptional. I have this receiver mated with the Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater Speaker System and I couldn't be more pleased with the overall package. For under $800 total for the receiver, speakers, wire, speaker stands - I have a great system on a reasonable budget.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I just hooked up my receiver last night and it seems to be working to everything as advertised. There are some details I need to fix on my end on the speaker end, but the calibration took a bout 2 min and without messing with settings yet it works really well. The app worked instantly and i can control the unit with my iPhone for most functions. Only thing that I need to learn is the settings interface, but with a unit this complex this was expected. Thank you Amazon and Yamaha
customer_reviews.author: Trailboss

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Everything looked perfect with this receiver and powered up fine but it had a C stock sticker on it which means no warranty. Amazon was happy to exchange it for a different model and covered the return shipping
customer_reviews.author: Hex

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use....good sound quality...many features
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace an Audiovox home theater unit. That unit was buggy, and difficult to operate. This was very easy to setup and operate. It has many music presets and connections. The network setup was fast and easy. All in all a no-brainer at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: ral1375

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile but I know what I like and I like this receiver. I've been an Onkyo customer for many years but this absolutely has more bang for the buck. And the Yamaha A/V controller app works flawlessly on both my Galaxy s3 phone and Asus tablet.
customer_reviews.author: lostinstowe

customer_reviews.title: does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even gotten through all the features yet. The only disappointment is that if you have a DVD player with component video, then it doesn't switch that to the HDMI out. You have to use the component video out of the unit. Otherwise the sound is stellar.
customer_reviews.author: E. C.

customer_reviews.title: But I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert. But I love it...the sound is really nice. I connect everything that we have to it. It even has internet radio stations....and you can control it from you smartphone. Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Cata82

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: great replacement for my 10 year old sony. does take some time to set up the way you wan tit. still have a problem with the scene function. overall a great reciever for the $$$. I am really happy wi thte purchase. I have it hooked up to a 5.1 system sounds great. I also have my apple tv running through it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Yancey

customer_reviews.title: Good Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of features that I don't use. Internet connection. Online radio setup is 90's look. nothing fancy I usually have it on for movies and occasional tv, I mostly I listen Pandora music through my BlueRay, and it sound great. The bass is excellent. Hardware was simple. A little expensive for the little use I have with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tbone

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this receiver since 2012 and i have to say the thing works flawless. Had a bit of trouble understanding the airplay at first. But once i learned how to use it, i was using it all the time. i also love the different setting for movies, music and games. And if you want a 2.1 sound, all you have to do is go to direct. This is my first home theater receiver and i am completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Michael Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up and very good sound
customer_reviews.text: My old A/V receiver stopped working and I decided on this unit mostly from feature set and Amazon reviews. Set-up was easy for my two sources (cable box and DVD) and 3 speaker (L/R front and center only) system. The mic-based speaker set-up took less than a minute. Everything works and the sound is much better than what I had. (hometheater.com reviewed this unit on Feb 8, 2013 and raved about the sound.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our older son who desperately needed a new receiver for his tv and sound equipment. It works perfectly and reduced the number of wires significantly. Perfect gift! Plus his wife and daughter love having access to their music.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Holcombe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound!
customer_reviews.text: My previous recevier was a Yamaha and it was great! So why go with anything else. I simply upgraded in order to get the HDMI connections to go with my new TV. Great product!! Wouldn't buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Really happy so far. I've had a couple small issues with it, but for the most part I'm really pleased. Setup was a snap, adjusting the speakers to my preference beyond that was also easy. Love the sound, much better than my old setup.
customer_reviews.author: Idahoamazonuser

customer_reviews.title: Strong Performance Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I was looking for a midrange receiver for a second room in my home. This was my choice, and I've been pleased. Although the set-up seemed a little confusing - everything worked perfectly on the first try. I have everything in my media room running through the receiver, and it all (tv, blu-ray, xbox, etc.) works flawlessly. I connected the receiver to the Uverse box in my media room and can now see the RX-V473 on my wireless network. Bottom-line, for the price, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: GSC

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: sounds ok to complicated....bought a sony that was more simple and has more power
customer_reviews.author: hannan lyda

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V473 5.1-Channel Network AV Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Disconnected my 6 month old Pioneer receiver and replaced it with this Yamaha and Wow, what a difference. Yamaha is the leader in sound recreation and it is simple to set up and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimminy Criket

customer_reviews.title: Value packed offering...#1 choice at the sub-300 range
customer_reviews.text: Splendid in terms of value and range for the price it comes for. The network feature works smoothly and is easy to setup. Sewell fast-bolt banana plugs work fine. I have paired it with BA Soundware S speakers and they come together like a charm....more than satisfied with the purchase. Thanks Yamaha and Amazon, and all the reviewers for helping me make what seems to be a smart decision
customer_reviews.author: Aseem

customer_reviews.title: Great amp and surround surround sound!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a stereo (music) guy and the surround sound sound is a side benefit. Yet I really dig this amp and it's ability to make any movie or sports event seem like I'm there. Read the other reviews this is as good as it gets under $500.
customer_reviews.author: lkjljlkj

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase! I bought this unit after purchasing TWO identical Sony products that I had to return due to defects. I love this unit and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: darbyala

customer_reviews.title: great recevier
customer_reviews.text: I just got this after returning my failed Onkyo. This thing is a beast, and is by far one of the best all around receivers I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Product Reviews International

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a much older unit. Very nice features. Easy to set-up. Easy to use. Plenty of HDMI connections. Not hard to customize the setup either.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Martin

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked
customer_reviews.text: Unit was DOA. On initial setup the onscreen GUI was garbled and remote was not working. Called Yamaha support and they determined the unit was indeed defective.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had no sound out of it ,no microphone for sound test,no manual for operation and trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome receiver for the price
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the Yamaha products. This receiver replaced a previous yamaha receiver. Loaded with great features. Can't be beat for the price. Easy setup and quality excellent.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Trouble gaming
customer_reviews.text: It not stable with ps3 or ps4. Had to change hdmi channel stabilize.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Was putting off writing this review for a while now to see if something would break, but no. It's been going strong, the sound is great, the signal processing is great, everything is simple and elegant. Top notch all around. I guess it's now discontinued due to new models coming in, but still, I'd even buy it used.
customer_reviews.author: Evgueni Gene Lange

customer_reviews.title: Plays all my music from my server
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate I can control it from my kindle fire or my smart phone good sound very happy with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and Value
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, remote is easy to use and jam-packed with features, online documentation thorough. Features. performance, and functionality great.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great 5.1 sound system
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy to set up and run with. Powerfull and clean system. Remote could be easier to operate, but, otherwise still great syste and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Problems with Airplay, App and Pandora
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it was because I bought a refurbished one, but I could not get the thing to work beyond the basics. Couldn't get the AirPlay, the App, or Pandora to work- I had this hardwired into my router and I have troubles getting it properly connected on the network. Wouldn't get a proper IP address. Very frustrating since I had just connected all my devices and speakers and was excited to get the thing jamming. They were great about the return, and I upgraded to the RX-V475 (also refurbished model), which worked perfectly right out of the box. Very happy with that receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Calimota

customer_reviews.title: This is very good
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. You can download an app onto your smartphone to remote control it. It can be set so that it can be turned-on from the app.
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: You cannot beat this item for this price
customer_reviews.text: This Amp is awesome. Fantastic sound seperation, easy to set up, makes my Energy TAKE 1 surround speakers light up. For the price of the competitors, this unit is the best per dollar.
customer_reviews.author: RCCleven

customer_reviews.title: Audio Video Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Great Sound. Video switching very easy. FM reception great. All around great receiver. Ipod hooks up easy
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V473 Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great AV receiver for price range, Amazon beat all comers for price. Gave it 4 stars due to only 4 HDMI inputs. Newer version of this receiver have the 5 inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Francis J Marochino

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver...none existent manual.....Have to use the provided cd for instructions...not very convenient for setting up this receiver specially for a novice such as me
customer_reviews.author: Mario G.

customer_reviews.title: Great networked AV Receiver.
customer_reviews.text: Lowest cost and best featured networked a/v receiver for the price. Controls well with the Yamaha a/v app and setup is intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Contact
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up the Yamaha RX v473 to TV and Roku. Pandora internet radio is accessed via the Roku. Ipod connects to the USB. All working fine.
customer_reviews.author: BDR1244

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice system. Only quirk is Airplay which only seems to work every now and then. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Campanella.

customer_reviews.title: Musical product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I chose this unit to drive the BIC F56 Sound Bar (5 channels). Yamaha offered the sound controls I need for all my video and audio sources. It brings out the best is the F56. Has network and HDMI, USB connects, etc. With all the features considered, it also was offered at the best price. Take the time to do all the settings, and it will deliver.
customer_reviews.author: W. V. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need it to, has all the bells and whistles my setup needs. The switching between signals is really fast, and it looks premium on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Fluidrock

customer_reviews.title: Hard  to beat Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: I'm a rock and roller from the 70s. I still like the music load and clear. With the Yamaha surround speakers, I couldn't ask for more
customer_reviews.author: con von

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This receiver was reccomended by my local high end stereo shop,but their unit was a demo model for $319.00. At $248 for new, Amazon crushed the competition! Excellent replacement for my previous Yamaha amp. HDMI minimizes wires. Got rid of yards of component video and digital audio and optical lines. Brings me into the 21st century with easy setup & super sound
customer_reviews.author: Larry hall

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a middle of the road recvr. Several firmware updates. Great customer/tech support
customer_reviews.author: Linda Cuilla

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: what a difference, love this receiver, I have it hooked up to the network and I-tunes, playing all my favorites
customer_reviews.author: kevin berry

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He is very pleased with both the appearance and performance of it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Liby

customer_reviews.title: Another great Yamaha product
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver! Full of features at a great price. The newer rx series offer airplay so if you got the money upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Thad northrop

customer_reviews.title: Great reciever
customer_reviews.text: This has many options for sound with the click of a couple of buttons on the remote. Movies are outstanding and so is music.
customer_reviews.author: alan k

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but realized I made my selection based on customer reviews so: I found what others have ssaid to be true. It is a feature rich good sounding reciever. The on screen interface is definitely not sexy but completely functional. The ipod/pad app is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with the Yamaha RX-V473. The separation is real good, set up was very easy. For a mid-range priced amp I would recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: T. Way

customer_reviews.title: Great value but too complicated
customer_reviews.text: It's a great receiver. I love the airplay and their iPhone app, which is iPhone 5 compatible. However, the setup is too complicated. There are a lot of unnecessary options. The difference between the preset modes are so minor that you won't even notice them. I used to own Sony receiver which was simple and efficient. I'm still trying to find the right setup for this receiver. If I can't, I'll return it and get my old Sony receiver back.
customer_reviews.author: Naif

customer_reviews.title: Delighted
customer_reviews.text: Great value and excellent sound. There are a couple of issues about it being rather difficult to understand (the reomte is a bit of a nightmare), and it's not the most intuitive machine ever, but when you consider the price, and most importantly the quality of the sound output, I am extremely pleased that I went Yamaha again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I bought this in February and 10 months later the HDMI port is bad
customer_reviews.text: Over $300, it should last a lot longer than this. Now I have to figure out the warranty, pay to ship it off, ugh. What a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: T. S.

customer_reviews.title: Airplay works great. Yamaha makes excellent electronics
customer_reviews.text: I use it everyday. Airplay works great. Yamaha makes excellent electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful for the price.
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of options and I still have not figured out how to use most of them. Great receiver.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kantola

customer_reviews.title: Overall great value system
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with the receiver messing up the color tv setting, unplugging hdmi and restarting fixed the issue. Overall great value system.
customer_reviews.author: tyler whaley

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the RX-V473.It is easy to select the correct sound for different movies, music,etc. Very easy to hook up and does a good out of the box. I do not beleave I could find abetter av reciver for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, works well with my new LG 3D flat screen. Easy to set up. Reasonably priced. Fills my house with good music.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great!
customer_reviews.text: Receiver was very easy to set up. The automatic speaker calibration worked well. The on screen menu isn't the best, but it's fuctional. The sound is great thru the Boston Acoustic speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: For someone who is technically challenged this is easy to use. Works great with our Vizio TV, Blu Ray and Sound Bar.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Great product / Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver. Just love it.Great sound, easy to use. Nice to be able to plug my Ipod into the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: RX-V473
customer_reviews.text: This unit rocks for the price hooked it up to the Energy 5.1 take classic speakers in a 12 x 25 foot room and it blew me away, no need to spend big bucks to get clear loud sound.
customer_reviews.author: dano

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver
customer_reviews.text: I like this receiver very much. With this price what else can you buy? I recommend this product. The main reason for me to buy this receiver is to replace my old Yamaha receiver which doesn't have any HDMI interfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Lichuan Chen

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to our living room
customer_reviews.text: The price was right, the unit was easy to install (with dvd and quick instructions) and the sound quality was better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: LarryMCPO

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: We read all the reviews and looked up ratings,in Consumer Reports and we are extremely satisfied with our decision. Satsfied customers
customer_reviews.author: JL in NH

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: still learning how to use everything, but works and sounds great. I pared this up with energy micro 5.1 and I love the way it sounds.
customer_reviews.author: brian fyffe

customer_reviews.title: tom from california
customer_reviews.text: for the price this unit was far more then i expected.lots of power great with the auto play. for the money i would tell anyone to buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Villegas

customer_reviews.title: comcast subscribers beware
customer_reviews.text: If you are a Comcast subscriber, please be aware that you will not be able to control this receiver with the dark silver remote used with comcast hd/dvr. The two Yamaha codes supplied by Comcast do not work for this model. Google searches reveal many others with the same issue. The receiver will power OFF when the TV is turned off but you will still have to use the Yamaha remote to power ON and for all other functions. Otherwise, the Yamaha RX-V473 is a very good product for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX V473 5.1 Channel Network AV Receiver (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:ReceiverStep up to a network receiver from Yamaha with the RX-V473. This affordable yet advanced receiver provides simple operation with network control via the free Yamaha AV Controller App for iPhone, iPad, and Android, plus enjoy enhanced audio capabilities with CINEMA DSP 3D for an enveloping home theater experience. Expand connectivity with Apple AirPlay and versatile USB input for iPad compatibility. Have confidence in your receiver for the future! With sophisticated technologies like 4k video pass-through and 20% less power consumption with ECO mode, the Yamaha RX-V473 will pass the test of time.2-Year Yamaha Limited Parts and Labor Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


YAMAHA RX-V473 5.1-CHANNEL NETWORK AV RECEIVER
 * Key Features 
 * Network receiver with AV Controller App for iPad/iPhone/iPod and Android phones/tablets
 * 5-channel powerful surround sound with 115W per Channel 
 * Apple Airplay Allows Streaming Music to AV Receiver
 * HD Audio format decoding: Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio; Dolby Digital Plus and DTS-HD High Resolution Audio
 * 4K pass-through for next generation super high resolution displays, and HDMI (4 in/1 out) with 3D and Audio Return Channel
 * Front panel USB Digital Connection for iPad/iPod/iPhone & MP3 
 * YPAO sound optimization for automatic speaker setup in minutes
 * Multi language color OSD for improved visibility
 * ECO mode operation for about 20%* less power consumption

 
STEP UP TO A NETWORK RECEIVER FROM YAMAHA WITH THE RX-V473
This affordable yet advanced receiver provides simple operation with network control via the free Yamaha AV Controller App for iPhone, iPad, and Android, plus enjoy enhanced audio capabilities with CINEMA DSP 3D for an enveloping home theater experience. Expand connectivity with Apple AirPlay and versatile USB input for iPad compatibility. Have confidence in your receiver for the future! With sophisticated technologies like 4k video pass-through and 20% less power consumption with ECO mode, the Yamaha RX-V473 will pass the test of time. 








4K PASS-THROUGH FOR NEXT GENERATION SUPER HIGH RESOLUTION IMAGES
This AV receiver provides advanced HDMI features including 4K pass-through. 4K refers to four times the resolution of a 1080p display. While not yet available, 4K displays and sources are sure to become popular in the future. This receiver is capable of passing the 4K data from the source to the display, for image clarity far beyond present standards. 






HDMI WITH 3D AND AUDIO RETURN CHANNEL
3D means the receiver can handle 3D signal data. The Audio Return Channel function enables data to be sent and received via the same HDMI cable, so you can hear the sound from the TV via a single HDMI cable, with no need for an extra optical cable.









NETWORK FUNCTIONS
This AV receiver provides a variety of network functions that enable you to access more sources and also enhance operation. You can connect the receiver to a PC to enjoy Internet Radio. The AV Controller app (from iTunes App Store or Android Market) lets you control various functions from your iPod, iPhone, iPad or Android phones.






View the Kindle App AV CONTROLLER APP FOR EASY, CONVENIENT OPERATION
This AV Receiver lets you use the Yamaha AV Controller app that is downloadable from the Amazon App Store, iTunes App Store or Android Market to control power on/off and volume, select input and DSP modes and operate other functions from your Kindle Fire, iPod, iPhone, iPad or Android device. A tablet version is also available.


CONTROL YOUR YAMAHA NETWORK RECEIVER WITH FREE KINDLE FIRE APP
With a Yamaha network receiver you can now control your music and media with our new app designed specifically for the #1 product on Amazon, the Kindle Fire. This application is FREE, and available for download on the Amazon App Store for Kindle Fire and other Android devices. Click here to check out the Kindle App for Yamaha Network Receivers.







AIRPLAY ALLOWS STREAMING MUSIC TO AV RECEIVER
This AV receiver supports AirPlay, which means they can accept wireless music streaming from iPod touch, iPhone or iPad, as well as from iTunes on Macs or PCs. This makes it easy to enjoy music from your mobile devices or computer on your home theater system. You can use view metadata such as song title, artist name as well as album art* via AV receiver's on-screen display. *Some models don't support album art display.










HDMI CEC FOR EASY OPERATION
Another benefit of HDMI is the availability of CEC functionality. When the unit is connected to a CEC compatible TV, it will turn on and off together with the TV, and you can use the TV remote to control the volume. CEC also provides advanced functionality with other components. For example, you can use the receiver’s remote unit to control player functions like Skip and Stop. 

*All connected devices must be HDMI CEC compatible. Some CEC compatible TVs/players may not work.






YPAO SOUND OPTIMIZATION FOR AUTOMATIC SPEAKER SETUP
YPAO analyzes the room acoustics and adjusts various audio parameters for optimum sound in just a few minutes. It’s like having a professional installer calibrate your system.










USB DIGITAL CONNECTION FOR IPOD, IPHONE AND IPAD ON THE FRONT PANEL
A USB port on the front panel allows convenient connection of an iPod/iPhone/iPad, which also charges when connected. Because the digital signal from the iPod/iPhone/iPad is transmitted directly to the AV receiver, there is no signal loss or interference, so you enjoy the best possible sound quality. In addition, you can use the receiver’s remote control unit to operate the iPod/iPhone/iPad music playback functions.






SCENE FOR ONE-TOUCH START
Pressing a SCENE button powers on the AV Receiver and selects the input source and DSP mode. You can re-set the buttons for different sources by selecting a source and DSP mode, then pressing a SCENE button for more than three seconds.






HD AUDIO WITH CINEMA DSP 3D AND VIRTUAL PRESENCE SPEAKER
CINEMA DSP 3D provides a wide, high and dense sound field. HD Audio format decoding lets you enjoy HD Audio sources. Virtual Presence Speaker delivers 3-dimensional sound without actual use of presence speakers.









INPUT SELECTION IN HDMI STANDBY THROUGH MODE
When the AV receiver is in HDMI Standby Through mode, the input source (Blu-ray™ Disc player, game console, etc.) for viewing on the monitor can be changed via the remote control. There’s no need to turn on the AV receiver in order to switch sources.









SUBWOOFER TRIM FOR IMPROVED SOUND IMAGING
The Subwoofer Trim control enhances the low frequencies by avoiding overlap with the front speaker output. This will result in a cleaner, more focused sound stage while providing a seamless frequency response. When subwoofer frequency overlap occurs in conventional systems, the overall sound is “pushed” toward the subwoofer. Subwoofer Trim takes care of this by separating the low subwoofer frequencies cleanly, thus stabilizing the front stage while providing a well-balanced enhanced bass sound.






COMPRESSED MUSIC ENHANCER
When music is encoded into a digitally compressed format like MP3, the frequency response suffers. Yamaha’s Compressed Music Enhancer employs sophisticated digital signal processing using exclusive algorithms to restore what was lost, so the music always sounds the way it should.







ADAPTIVE DRC (DYNAMIC RANGE CONTROL)
Adaptive DRC automatically adjusts the dynamic range of the sound according to the volume level. This ensures that you hear clear dialogue and vocals, and all sound effects at comfortable levels. There is no need to adjust the volume level as you listen; everything from whispers to big explosions will be heard clearly and comfortably at the same volume setting. It also tones down loud TV commercials, and is ideal for low-volume, late-night listening, when you do not want to disturb others.






ECO MODE LOWERS POWER CONSUMPTION BY 20%*
Yamaha’s new ECO mode reduces power consumption by about 20%. It can be set from the top of the GUI menu. 
* Compared to power consumption when ECO mode is off (Yamaha measurement).

SELECTABLE AUTO POWER DOWN
Auto Power Down lets you save energy by selecting to turn off the power after 2, 4, 8 or 12 hours. 
* Compared to power consumption when ECO mode is off (Yamaha measurement).


LOW STANDBY POWER CONSUMPTION
Yamaha makes its receivers eco-friendly with a low standby power consumption of 0.1W in IR Standby mode (1W in HDMI Standby Through mode, 2W in Network Standby mode).






OTHER NOTABLE ADVANCED FEATURES
 * Charging of iPod, iPhone and iPad via USB when AV Receiver is off 
 * iPod/iPhone song titles displayed in English and Western European languages on the front panel 
 * Multi language color OSD for improved visibility 
 * Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input 
 * Front panel mini jack input for connecting portable audio player 
 * Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input 
 * 9 selectable subwoofer crossover frequencies 
 * Subwoofer phase select / Subwoofer out 
 * Initial Volume Setting and Maximum Volume Setting 
 * Audio Delay for adjusting Lip-Sync (0-250 ms)
 * 40-station preset tuning / Auto preset tuning
 * Background Video feature (for Radio only)






WHICH YAMAHA RX-V SERIES RECEIVER IS RIGHT FOR YOU?
YAMAHA RX-V373
Check out the Yamaha RX-V373 YAMAHA RX-V473
Check out the Yamaha RX-V473 YAMAHA RX-V573

Check out the Yamaha RX-V773 POWER
